intro: Haemadictyon calycinum, commonly known as the golden star clover, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, yellow flowers. The plant is typically found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has a creeping growth habit with stolons that root at the nodes, allowing it to spread and form dense mats. The seeds are small and often dispersed by wind, contributing to its ability to colonize new areas.
